message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) as it focuses on building a writing aid system that automatically edits a text to adhere to academic style of writing. The paper also uses resources such as the Corpus of Contemporary American English (COCA) academic Word List and the New Academic Word List, which are commonly used in NLP research. 

The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as paraphrase generation and ranking, which are commonly used in the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). 

Finally, the paper's use of different generic approaches to compile resources that can be extended for different domains and languages suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE), which often involves developing domain-independent methodologies.
